Title: Fulfillment Center Assets Protection Operations Intern (Current Students) (Rialto, CA)
Required Qualifications:
Description

Assets Protection Operations Intern

All About Target

Target is one of the world’s most recognized brands and one of America’s leading retailers. And our Distribution Centers are key to that success, whether guests shop our stores or online. It’s our DC team who make sure that products arrive at our stores (and guests’ doorsteps) on time, every time.

As part of our collaborative and guest-obsessed team, you help us create an experience that makes guests say, “I love Target!” When you work at Target, you’re helping every family discover the joy in everyday life. You’re working alongside a dedicated team that brings their passion and pride to all that they do.

All About Supply Chain Leadership

As an Assets Protection Operations Intern, you’ll gain a realistic job preview into life as an Assets Protection Operations Manager. You will have the opportunity to learn to lead, motivate and influence a team, and be responsible for the execution of Assets Protection routines and initiatives to support secure environments and protect Target’s profitability. You will also learn to lead a secure work environment that ensures the security of our teams, vendors, buildings and merchandise. The Assets Protection team’s function is to provide a secure environment for our team members and mitigate shortage to increase profitability in a Target distribution center. Assets Protection teams will do this by leading a physical security culture and responding to crisis events, investigating and resolving theft, and educating team members on operational shortage priorities. It’s the leadership you will learn that will guide your team to proactively plan to increase supply chain efficiencies. We’ll be supporting you with extensive training to help you grow as a strong assets protection operations intern. During our 8-week summer program, you will work closely with a mentor while learning different business areas and functions within our buildings. You will spend your days learning to lead and motivate a team and drive results. It will be your acquired leadership that guides your team to grow and achieve goals.

Role

The role of an Assets Protection Operations Intern can provide you with the

At Target, we believe in our leaders having meaningful experiences that help them build and develop skills for a career.

Experience in building and managing a team culture
Skills on how to make an impact on our guests; problem solving and resolution
Knowledge of retail business fundamentals
Experience setting and planning department(s) daily/weekly workload to support business priorities and managing a team to deliver goals
Experience managing a team of hourly team members and creating business strategies and goals

Responsibilities

As an Assets Protection Operations Intern, no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities

Provide new ideas and recommend solutions to business or team opportunities
Take initiative to learn how to be a Target leader by seeking out opportunities for growth and development; continuously learn throughout the internship experience
Commit to learning Target’s expectations of leaders and use them to personally develop by asking questions and seeking feedback
Actively participate in internship program training activities, developmental opportunities and events.
Demonstrate willingness to take risks; step out of comfort zone and take on new assignments
Partner with leaders regarding TM performance by teaching, coaching, training and delivering timely performance feedback
Demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, safety, and compliance; learn to lead the team to work in the same way and hold others accountable to this commitment
Understand business reporting and guest insights to understand, troubleshoot and follow-up on opportunity areas. Work with buildings leaders each day to set goals and expectations
Gain understanding of all business areas to develop business acumen
Foster an inclusive, diverse, safe and secure culture
Carry out principle duties and responsibilities by department through internship rotations as trained.
All other duties based on business needs

What We Are Looking For

We might be a great match if:

Working in a fun and energetic environment makes you excited… We work efficiently and as a team to deliver for our guests
Providing service to our guests that makes them say “I LOVE TARGET!” excites you… That’s why we love working at Target
You enjoy leading teams who are working to get products to our stores and guests… That’s the core of what we do
You aren’t looking for a Monday thru Friday job where you are at a computer all day… We are busy all day (especially on the weekends), getting merchandise to our teams and guests

Skills

But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go

The good news is that we have some amazing training that will help teach you everything you need to know to be an Assets Protection Operations Intern.
College Senior class standing or entering senior year; G.P.A. of 3.0 or higher
Participation in school or extracurricular activities and experience in leadership roles
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively
Strong critical thinking, reasoning, analytical and problem solving skills
Team-oriented thinking with enthusiasm for continuous learning
Proven ability to motivate teams and manage conflict
Ability to access all levels and areas of the facility
Ability to interpret instructions, reports, and other data
Ability to climb up and down ladders
Ability to scan, handle and move merchandise efficiently and safely, including frequently lifting or moving merchandise up to 15 pounds and occasionally or moving merchandise up to 40 pounds
Flexible work schedule (e.g., nights, weekends and holidays) and regular work attendance necessary
